summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to American Airlines, dated January 23, 2020. It commands the production of passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell for two time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward) as part of an investigation into federal crimes including sex trafficking. The subpoena includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena to American Airlines as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all records for Ghislaine Maxwell (also known as Ghislaine Borgerson) from American Airlines for the periods January 1994 through December 1998 and July 2019 onward.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for American Airlines
events.description: The subpoena commands American Airlines to appear before the grand jury on this date to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced to the FBI by the return date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to American Airlines for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 4333 Amon Carter Blvd., Ft. Worth, TX 76155 (American Airlines Corporate Security address)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (Grand Jury location)
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office for record delivery)
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to American Airlines on January 23, 2020, seeking all passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell for two specific time periods: January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019, through the date of service.

The investigation concerns alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement of a minor), and 371 (conspiracy).

The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that American Airlines voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

The subpoena indicates the investigation was active and focused on Ghislaine Maxwell's travel patterns, with one historical period (mid-1990s) and one contemporary period (mid-2019 onward) being scrutinized.
